title: Socially-distanced Santa's Grottos can open for Christmas
description: Carol singing is also allowed - but people will not be able to go to school nativity plays in some areas.

title: Cher and the rescue of a lonely elephant in Pakistan
description: Singer Cher was one of those who campaigned for a better life for Kavaan the elephant who is now heading to a new home.

title: Covid: Boris Johnson writes to MPs to quell anger over new tiers
description: Facing a rebellion in his party, Boris Johnson tells MPs that England's new rules could end in nine weeks.

title: Covid in Scotland: Sturgeon defends handling of pandemic
description: Scotland's first minister says it is too soon to be comparing Scotland's record with England.

title: Dave Prowse: Darth Vader actor dies aged 85
description: The former bodybuilder was also given an MBE for his long-running role as the Green Cross Code Man.

title: Smith scores second century as Australia wrap up ODI series win over India
description: Steve Smith scores his second century in as many games as Australia beat India by 51 runs in the second one-day international to win the series.

title: Brexit: UK in 'last leg' of trade talks with EU, says Raab
description: The foreign secretary said a deal was possible if the EU side showed "pragmatism" in the coming days.

title: Turkey cull after bird flu discovered at Northallerton farm
description: All 10,500 turkeys will be culled after a strain of avian influenza was found in North Yorkshire.

title: 'Fireball' dazzles in the sky in Japan
description: The meteor was seen descending towards earth for a few seconds, before emitting a powerful light.

title: Arcadia: Sir Philip Green 'must plug Arcadia pension hole'
description: His retail empire, including Topshop and Dorothy Perkins, is understood to be on the brink of collapse.

title: 'The Big Bash is the best competition in the world - The Hundred can a learn a lot'
description: The Big Bash League in Australia sets the standard in women's cricket. How will The Hundred compare next summer?

title: 'Rugby needs to change its laws to keep kids watching'
description: Former England scrum-half Matt Dawson says rugby needs to change its laws to keep it entertaining for all fans.

title: Utah monolith: Has the mysterious metal object disappeared?
description: Utah officials and images on social media suggest the shiny desert structure has been taken down.

title: Farm workers killed in 'insane' Nigeria attack
description: Nigeria's president condemns an attack in which 43 labourers were "slaughtered" near Maiduguri.

title: Adam King: Six-year-old Irish boy's space ambition 'inspires' Nasa
description: Adam King from County Cork captured the hearts of TV viewers with dreams of joining a space mission.

title: Liverpool: How one city took on the Covid-19 crisis
description: The inside story of how Liverpool got to grips with soaring infection rates and pioneered mass testing.

title: Sydney records hottest November night on record
description: The Australian city recorded a minimum overnight temperature of 25.4C.

title: 'Stop celebrity boxing, someone will get really hurt'
description: Boxers are quick to question how former NBA basketball player Nate Robinson was allowed to be knocked out by YouTube star Jake Paul.

title: Lorde on Antarctica: Thrilling and intense... but eerie
description: The singer says she found inspiration for her next album during a visit to the bottom of the world.

title: 'Like two of my uncles fighting at a barbecue' - Tyson and Jones draw exhibition bout
description: Mike Tyson ends 15 years of inactivity and shares an entertaining draw with Roy Jones Jr in Los Angeles.

title: Canada bans mass exports of prescription drugs
description: The new policy comes in response to a US plan to import drugs from Canada.

title: The Papers: Tory MPs' hospital anger, and PM 'in retreat'
description: Sunday's papers are dominated by the new tier system, which has divided the Conservative party.

title: The 'Robin Hood' policemen who stole from the Nazis
description: How did 16 policemen come to be deported from the British Isles to Nazi-occupied Europe?

title: Gary Barlow: 'I'm not as confident as I was at 21'
description: The star discusses writing Back For Good in 15 minutes, and how Morecambe and Wise inspired a new song.

title: Covid-19: What’s the harm of ‘funny’ anti-vaccine memes?
description: Spreading jokes about vaccines can stoke unnecessary fears.

title: Covid and schools: 'Children know things aren't right'
description: Students have lost hundreds of days of education to Covid and self-isolation. How are they coping?

title: London Bridge attack: 'I think about it every single day'
description: Former prisoner Marc Conway remembers the London Bridge attack one year on.

title: Serbia coronavirus: The Church losing its leaders to the pandemic
description: Few organisations have taken a bigger hit from coronavirus than the Serbian Orthodox Church

title: Rosamund Adoo-Kissi-Debrah: 'Did air pollution kill my daughter?'
description: A new inquest into the death of Ella Adoo-Kissi-Debrah could list air pollution as a cause of her death.

title: In pictures: Hurricanes leave Hondurans homeless and destitute
description: Hurricanes Eta and Iota left more than 150,000 people in Honduras homeless and many lost everything.

title: Khachaturyan sisters: A murder trial that shocked Russia
description: The case of the three Khachaturyan sisters accused of killing their father sent shockwaves through Russia.

title: TikTok: 'I didn’t know other LGBT Muslims existed'
description: Until she found her social media "safe space", Shaz says she didn't know there were others like her.

title: Ethiopia's Tigray crisis: What does it mean for the east Africa region?
description: BBC correspondents across the east Africa region explain the impact for Ethiopia and its neighbours.

title: Leroy Logan: Who is the Met Police officer in Steve McQueen's Red, White and Blue?
description: Star Wars' John Boyega is set to star in the true story of a black police officer in 1980s London.
